column4: i have a problem when enabling nvidia proprietary graphic driver, my virtual consoles (Ctrl-Alt-F[1-6]) are flickering and are unusable. what is this?
lucky you, my are not even accessible ;d (ASUS UL30VT)
your grpx drivers? :( i have google'd it, and one solution was something about framebuffer...
didn't have time to look into that. I've just put I'm I don't have those tty accessible ;(
my nvidia card is on, but system is using integrated chip for the time being
good luck with that. you might find someone here to help you. just ask from time to time :)
preferably with your hardware specs / laptop model
I'd call it "welcoming to the same problem club" ;)
hehe yeah, damn these proprietary drivers.
true. that's why, eventually, I'm using noveau (if I'm using it. I'm not even sure)
ok, maybe you have some idea of how i can apply proper resolution to my laptop without prop. drivers? because thats the reason i have to use them..
some time ago there was xorg.conf ... but now it's legacy. I don't know how to change the resolution manually (from the console)
ok, some googling ahead then, thx
acicula: ok i will look into that :)
